fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom
Class HangingProtocolQueryRetrieveSCP

Object
  QueryRetrieveSCP
      HangingProtocolQueryRetrieveSCP

public class HangingProtocolQueryRetrieveSCP
extends QueryRetrieveSCP

Implements a Hanging Procol Query/Retrieve SCP together with a user supplied QueryRetrieveSCPListener implementation.

A QueryRetrieveSCPListener instance must be specified in the constructor. The listener methods are called when the SCP receives requests.

HangingProtocolQueryRetrieveSCP

public HangingProtocolQueryRetrieveSCP(QueryRetrieveSCPListener listener,
                                       int port,
                                       InetAddress addr,
                                       SecureTransport st)
Creates a Hanging Protocol Query/Retrieve SCP that will listen for requests on the specified port when QuerySCP.start() is called. The transport will be insecure if st is null. The SCP will listen to all local addresses if addr is null.

Method Detail

start

public void start()
           throws IOException
Binds the TCP server if it has not already been bound and starts to listen for query and retrieve requests.

Throws:
IOException

stop

public void stop()
          throws IOException
Stops answering to query and retrieve requests. Unbinds the TCP server if there are no more SCP listening.

Throws:
IOException

setApplicationTitles

public void setApplicationTitles(String[] calling,
                                 String[] called)
This class will only handle messages from associations using calling and called Application Entitities (AE) titles listed in the specified arrays. Passing a null array means that any AE will be accepted. By default, every called and calling AE are accepted. This method must be called before the service is started.

setApplicationTitles

public void setApplicationTitles(String calling,
                                 String called)
Convenient replacement for setApplicationTitles(String[], String[]) when using single titles. Passing a null String meants that any AE will be accepted.
